item.title: Comment on Engine Issue at Formula Bharat – Decompression Lever Damage by Rishikesh
item.dc:creator: Rishikesh
item.description: The battery used was a 6Ah LFP from Shorai Batteries and has a peak discharge of 220 Amps. Now that sounds good but the starter motor is not powerful enough to crank up the vehicle. So a battery with a higher CCA rating would do no good in this case.
item.content:encoded: The battery used was a 6Ah LFP from Shorai Batteries and has a peak discharge of 220 Amps. Now that sounds good but the starter motor is not powerful enough to crank up the vehicle. So a battery with a higher CCA rating would do no good in this case.

item.content:encoded: Swapnil, you can use any radiator which can satisfy your needs. Not mandatory to use a stock one.

item.title: Comment on Engine Issue at Formula Bharat – Decompression Lever Damage by Danish
item.dc:creator: Danish
item.description: Did you faced any problems with the braking system since you are using only 1 master cylinder? Does all the 4 wheels lock together when the brake is actuated? Or are you using a proportionating valve in the rear lines to limit the rear pressure?
item.content:encoded: Did you faced any problems with the braking system since you are using only 1 master cylinder? Does all the 4 wheels lock together when the brake is actuated? Or are you using a proportionating valve in the rear lines to limit the rear pressure?

item.title: Comment on Engine Issue at Formula Bharat – Decompression Lever Damage by Param
item.dc:creator: Param
item.description: Another thing I'd like to know is, what is the CCA of the battery? Because although the compression is pretty high at higher temperatures, a standard Amaron or Exide battery was enough to crank our old R6 in it's 'hot' condition.
item.content:encoded: Another thing I’d like to know is, what is the CCA of the battery? Because although the compression is pretty high at higher temperatures, a standard Amaron or Exide battery was enough to crank our old R6 in it’s ‘hot’ condition.

item.title: Comment on Engine Issue at Formula Bharat – Decompression Lever Damage by Kushal
item.dc:creator: Kushal
item.description: One suggestion to all teams would be when your engine is not firing up due to some electrical or mechanical issue don't keep on cranking the engine for long time.Find out the problem,rectify it and then crank. 1)When using a stock ECU a Ktm Engine should start within 2-3cranks,if not there's definitely a problem.More we crank without the engine getting fired up,there is improper lubrication to the cams and other parts which lead to excessive wear than designed. 2)When using a standalone ECU number of iterations are done during initial starting and tuning phase.Even there can be a chance of failure of decomp lever.So make sure you change your decomp lever even if there is slight change in the cranking sound.
item.content:encoded:
One suggestion to all teams would be when your engine is not firing up due to some electrical or mechanical issue don’t keep on cranking the engine for long time.Find out the problem,rectify it and then crank.
1)When using a stock ECU a Ktm Engine should start within 2-3cranks,if not there’s definitely a problem.More we crank without the engine getting fired up,there is improper lubrication to the cams and other parts which lead to excessive wear than designed.
2)When using a standalone ECU number of iterations are done during initial starting and tuning phase.Even there can be a chance of failure of decomp lever.So make sure you change your decomp lever even if there is slight change in the cranking sound.

item.title: Comment on Engine Issue at Formula Bharat – Decompression Lever Damage by Abhishek Patil
item.dc:creator: Abhishek Patil
item.description: Disassembling the head ain't a good option since you can face issues with the cylinder head sealing and also with the tightening torque of the cylinder head bolts. The other methods are, you hear a peculiar sound that the engine creates while cranking it seems as if the battery has discharged. The piston just constraints as the the starter motor simply draws current. Also you can frequently check for the battery voltage as a damaged decomp drains out the battery faster.
item.content:encoded: Disassembling the head ain’t a good option since you can face issues with the cylinder head sealing and also with the tightening torque of the cylinder head bolts. The other methods are, you hear a peculiar sound that the engine creates while cranking it seems as if the battery has discharged. The piston just constraints as the the starter motor simply draws current. Also you can frequently check for the battery voltage as a damaged decomp drains out the battery faster.

item.title: Comment on Engine Issue at Formula Bharat – Decompression Lever Damage by Abhishek Patil
item.dc:creator: Abhishek Patil
item.description: The compression ratio of KTM 390 is 12.6:1 but the compression leak the decomp lever was not measured or calculated.
item.content:encoded: The compression ratio of KTM 390 is 12.6:1 but the compression leak the decomp lever was not measured or calculated.

item.title: Comment on Engine Issue at Formula Bharat – Decompression Lever Damage by Alok apte
item.dc:creator: Alok apte
item.description: You don't need to remove the engine head as the decomp lever is on the exhaust camshaft. Simply open the valve cover check the lever and close it back again.
item.content:encoded: You don’t need to remove the engine head as the decomp lever is on the exhaust camshaft. Simply open the valve cover check the lever and close it back again.

item.title: Comment on Engine Issue at Formula Bharat – Decompression Lever Damage by Rujul
item.dc:creator: Rujul
item.description: It's great sharing such information. A good read. So disassembling the whole cylinder head is the only method to routine check the lever? Also, are there any symptoms observable or audible before reaching this stage of lever failure?
item.content:encoded:
It’s great sharing such information. A good read.
So disassembling the whole cylinder head is the only method to routine check the lever? Also, are there any symptoms observable or audible before reaching this stage of lever failure?

item.title: Comment on Engine Issue at Formula Bharat – Decompression Lever Damage by Param
item.dc:creator: Param
item.description: What was the compression in the cylinder with the decompression lever actuated and in it's de-actuated state?
item.content:encoded: What was the compression in the cylinder with the decompression lever actuated and in it’s de-actuated state?
